section.name: Introduction
section.p: To understand it you need a basic understanding of ledgers. A ledger consists of a list of transactions. Each transaction has a credit and a debit book (or account) as well as an amount. This means each transaction affects one account negatively and one account positively. To view the balance of a book you simply add up all the credit amounts and deduct all the debit amounts.

section.name: API Overview
section.p:
The API currently consists of 3 main classes:
Ledger
Book
Transaction
Implementing classes extend the abstract class Ledger. Book and Transaction are final as are several items in the Ledger class.
